data.name: 2b7d7575-4a16-5307-a010-04d0221e8bf5
data.notes: Poster presentation at the Int. Global Atmospheric Chemistry (IGAC) Project 2016 Science Conference, Sept. 26-30, 2016, Breckenridge, CO, USA. It describes results from a multi-model study of impacts of atmospheric processes on black carbon in the Arctic. Please note that content is available in English only.

notes_translated.en: Poster presentation at the Int. Global Atmospheric Chemistry (IGAC) Project 2016 Science Conference, Sept. 26-30, 2016, Breckenridge, CO, USA. It describes results from a multi-model study of impacts of atmospheric processes on black carbon in the Arctic. Please note that content is available in English only.
notes_translated.fr: Présentation par affiche à l’occasion de la Conférence scientifique de 2016 sur le projet international chargé de l’étude de la chimie atmosphérique de la planète (IGAC), du 26 au 30 septembre 2016, à Breckenridge, CO, États-Unis. Il explique les résultats d’une étude multimodèle portant sur les répercussions des processus atmosphériques sur le carbone noir dans l’Arctique. Veuillez noter que le contenu  est disponible en Anglais seulement.

data.name: 2c910c37-c684-561e-9e0b-1d5bb6ca5fb9
data.notes: In alignment with Statistics Canada’s modernization agenda, particularly the pillar for building capacity that will increase overall statistical literacy as well as its commitment to the Canada Data Strategy to support the optimization of the value of data by sharing good practices, Statistics Canada has developed a Confidentiality Classification Tool (CCT) that is used to evaluate its data products for disclosure risk. To assist users in working with the tool, a User Guide has also been developed. While both the tool and the guide were developed for internal purposes, the User Guide contains information on disclosure control concepts that may be useful to other organizations working with confidential information (such as microdata files and summary tables).

notes_translated.en: In alignment with Statistics Canada’s modernization agenda, particularly the pillar for building capacity that will increase overall statistical literacy as well as its commitment to the Canada Data Strategy to support the optimization of the value of data by sharing good practices, Statistics Canada has developed a Confidentiality Classification Tool (CCT) that is used to evaluate its data products for disclosure risk. To assist users in working with the tool, a User Guide has also been developed. While both the tool and the guide were developed for internal purposes, the User Guide contains information on disclosure control concepts that may be useful to other organizations working with confidential information (such as microdata files and summary tables).
notes_translated.fr: Afin de moderniser son approche en matière de contrôle de la divulgation, Statistique Canada a mis au point un outil de classification de la confidentialité (OCC), qui est utilisé pour évaluer le risque de divulgation de ses produits. Afin d’aider les utilisateurs à travailler avec l’outil, un guide de l’utilisateur a également été élaboré. Bien que l’outil et le guide aient été créés à des fins internes, le guide de l’utilisateur contient de l’information sur des concepts relatifs au contrôle de la divulgation susceptibles d’être utiles à d’autres organisations travaillant avec des renseignements confidentiels (tels que les fichiers de microdonnées et les tableaux sommaires).

en: Canada-United States Regulatory Cooperation Council │coopération réglementaire
Le Conseil de coopération Canada-États-Unis en matière de réglementation

data.name: 33e4dc0e-5976-52ca-98f2-d9afc1d6cd9b
data.notes: The document is a compilation of three presentations provided to Canadian stakeholders at a consultation event on June 14, 2017. The first presentation provides background information and a status update on regulatory cooperation activities under the Canada-U.S. Regulatory Cooperation Council. The second presentation outlines Canada’s regulatory cooperation with domestic and European Union partners. The third presentation provides an overview of key elements to include in stakeholder submissions of potential new areas for regulatory cooperation.

notes_translated.en: The document is a compilation of three presentations provided to Canadian stakeholders at a consultation event on June 14, 2017. The first presentation provides background information and a status update on regulatory cooperation activities under the Canada-U.S. Regulatory Cooperation Council. The second presentation outlines Canada’s regulatory cooperation with domestic and European Union partners. The third presentation provides an overview of key elements to include in stakeholder submissions of potential new areas for regulatory cooperation.
notes_translated.fr: Ce document est une compilation de trois présentations offertes aux intervenants canadiens à l’occasion d’une activité de consultation tenue le 14 juin 2017. La première présentation fournit des renseignements généraux et une mise à jour sur les activités de coopération en matière de réglementation dans le cadre du Conseil de coopération Canada-États-Unis en matière de réglementation. La deuxième présentation décrit la coopération en matière de réglementation entre le Canada et ses partenaires au pays et ceux de l’Union européenne. La troisième présentation donne un aperçu des éléments importants à inclure dans les présentations des intervenants sur les nouveaux secteurs d’activités où la coopération en matière de réglementation serait possible.

data.name: 592252c6-c351-5b24-8f0f-8acee56309b7
data.notes: APIs used to strictly belong to the technical domain, where developers would use them to access and/or extend application functionality using low level programmatic libraries. As such, the actual business value of APIs was realized more or less indirectly through enhanced application functionality. Things have changed though with the exponential growth of mobile applications and cloud based services. APIs (or Web APIs, to be more accurate) have emerged as strategic digital assets that have become an integral part of many service providers’ business models. It is TBS’s intent to expand upon its Government Open Data initiative to exploit the full potential of APIs and this document is a first step towards that goal. The GC API White Paper 3rd draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.

notes_translated.en: APIs used to strictly belong to the technical domain, where developers would use them to access and/or extend application functionality using low level programmatic libraries. As such, the actual business value of APIs was realized more or less indirectly through enhanced application functionality. Things have changed though with the exponential growth of mobile applications and cloud based services. APIs (or Web APIs, to be more accurate) have emerged as strategic digital assets that have become an integral part of many service providers’ business models. It is TBS’s intent to expand upon its Government Open Data initiative to exploit the full potential of APIs and this document is a first step towards that goal. The GC API White Paper 3rd draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.
notes_translated.fr: Les API appartenaient autrefois strictement au domaine technique, alors que les développeurs les utilisaient pour avoir accès et/ou élargir la fonction des applications au moyen des bibliothèques programmatiques de bas niveau. Les choses ont changé avec la croissance exponentielle des applications mobiles et des services en nuage. Les API (ou les API Web, pour être plus précis) sont apparues comme des biens stratégiques numériques qui font désormais partie intégrante des modèles opérationnels de beaucoup de fournisseurs de service.  C’est l’intention du Secrétariat du Conseil du Trésor du Canada (SCT) d’élargir l’initiative de données ouvertes afin d’exploiter le plein potentiel des API, et ce document se veut une première étape vers cet objectif.  Cette 3ième ébauche du livre blanc sur les APIs au gouvernement vous est soumis pour évaluation. Vos commentaires seront les bienvenus.

data.notes: This is a draft work plan for the Canada Open Government Working Group for 2017-2018. The work plan covers six priority areas: adoption of Open Data Charter, identifying high value data sets, economic benefits of open data, online federated open data search, engagement and training/open data literacy, and performance measures.

notes_translated.en: This is a draft work plan for the Canada Open Government Working Group for 2017-2018. The work plan covers six priority areas: adoption of Open Data Charter, identifying high value data sets, economic benefits of open data, online federated open data search, engagement and training/open data literacy, and performance measures.
notes_translated.fr: Ébauche de plan de travail pour le Groupe de travail sur le gouvernement ouvert du Canada de 2017-2018. Le plan de travail aborde six secteurs prioritaires : adoption d’une charte sur les données ouverte; détermination d’ensembles de données d’une grande valeur; avantages économiques des données ouvertes, recherche fédérée de données ouvertes en ligne, mobilisation et formation / littéracie en matière de données ouvertes et mesures du rendement.

data.name: 653fa14b-aa83-58a2-b5f5-81b877d27837
data.notes: APIs used to strictly belong to the technical domain, where developers would use them to access and/or extend application functionality using low level programmatic libraries. As such, the actual business value of APIs was realized more or less indirectly through enhanced application functionality. Things have changed though with the exponential growth of mobile applications and cloud based services. APIs (or Web APIs, to be more accurate) have emerged as strategic digital assets that have become an integral part of many service providers’ business models. It is TBS’s intent to expand upon its Government Open Data initiative to exploit the full potential of APIs and this document is a first step towards that goal. The GC API White Paper 3rd draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.

notes_translated.en: APIs used to strictly belong to the technical domain, where developers would use them to access and/or extend application functionality using low level programmatic libraries. As such, the actual business value of APIs was realized more or less indirectly through enhanced application functionality. Things have changed though with the exponential growth of mobile applications and cloud based services. APIs (or Web APIs, to be more accurate) have emerged as strategic digital assets that have become an integral part of many service providers’ business models. It is TBS’s intent to expand upon its Government Open Data initiative to exploit the full potential of APIs and this document is a first step towards that goal. The GC API White Paper 3rd draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.
notes_translated.fr: Les API appartenaient autrefois strictement au domaine technique, alors que les développeurs les utilisaient pour avoir accès et/ou élargir la fonction des applications au moyen des bibliothèques programmatiques de bas niveau. Les choses ont changé avec la croissance exponentielle des applications mobiles et des services en nuage. Les API (ou les API Web, pour être plus précis) sont apparues comme des biens stratégiques numériques qui font désormais partie intégrante des modèles opérationnels de beaucoup de fournisseurs de service.  C’est l’intention du Secrétariat du Conseil du Trésor du Canada (SCT) d’élargir l’initiative de données ouvertes afin d’exploiter le plein potentiel des API, et ce document se veut une première étape vers cet objectif.  Cette 3ième ébauche du livre blanc sur les APIs au gouvernement vous est soumis pour évaluation. Vos commentaires seront les bienvenus.

data.notes: This document provides a detailed breakdown of the expected knowledge, behaviours and experiences, by level of proficiency (basic, intermediate, expert) and by phase of lifecycle (planning, acquisition, use/maintenance and disposal), for each of the nine “core” federal real property functions. Please note that content is available in English only.

notes_translated.en: This document provides a detailed breakdown of the expected knowledge, behaviours and experiences, by level of proficiency (basic, intermediate, expert) and by phase of lifecycle (planning, acquisition, use/maintenance and disposal), for each of the nine “core” federal real property functions. Please note that content is available in English only.
notes_translated.fr: Ce document offre une ventilation détaillée des comportements et des expériences attendus, par niveau de compétence (élémentaire, intermédiaire, expert) et par phase du cycle de vie (planification, acquisition, fonctionnement et entretien, et aliénation), pour chacune des neuf fonctions de base en matière de biens immobiliers au gouvernement fédéral. Veuillez prendre note que ce contenu n’est offert qu’en anglais.

data.name: 89512cd5-c7b0-555c-9c0f-31e8ca9e4107
data.notes: In its leadership role as capacity builder in information management and information technology, the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat’s Chief Information Officer Branch (CIOB) is championing the paradigm shift from a siloed service delivery model to a horizontally integrated service delivery model enabled through digital services. The Government of Canada Interoperability Maturity Model (GCIMM) was developed as a product of that effort.   The GCIMM was developed with the goal of fostering a mindset of thinking enterprise first and interoperable by default. The GCIMM paints a picture, in broad strokes, of what the GC may look like in the not too distant future of pervasive digital services accessible anywhere, any time, and what it will take to get us there.  The GCIMM 1st draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.

notes_translated.en: In its leadership role as capacity builder in information management and information technology, the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat’s Chief Information Officer Branch (CIOB) is championing the paradigm shift from a siloed service delivery model to a horizontally integrated service delivery model enabled through digital services. The Government of Canada Interoperability Maturity Model (GCIMM) was developed as a product of that effort.   The GCIMM was developed with the goal of fostering a mindset of thinking enterprise first and interoperable by default. The GCIMM paints a picture, in broad strokes, of what the GC may look like in the not too distant future of pervasive digital services accessible anywhere, any time, and what it will take to get us there.  The GCIMM 1st draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.

data.name: 922cf2be-bedc-5ed6-b26a-c27b79685915
data.notes: In its leadership role as capacity builder in information management and information technology, the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat’s Chief Information Officer Branch (CIOB) is championing the paradigm shift from a siloed service delivery model to a horizontally integrated service delivery model enabled through digital services. The Government of Canada Interoperability Maturity Model (GCIMM) was developed as a product of that effort.   The GCIMM was developed with the goal of fostering a mindset of thinking enterprise first and interoperable by default. The GCIMM paints a picture, in broad strokes, of what the GC may look like in the not too distant future of pervasive digital services accessible anywhere, any time, and what it will take to get us there.  The GCIMM 1st draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.

notes_translated.en: In its leadership role as capacity builder in information management and information technology, the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat’s Chief Information Officer Branch (CIOB) is championing the paradigm shift from a siloed service delivery model to a horizontally integrated service delivery model enabled through digital services. The Government of Canada Interoperability Maturity Model (GCIMM) was developed as a product of that effort.   The GCIMM was developed with the goal of fostering a mindset of thinking enterprise first and interoperable by default. The GCIMM paints a picture, in broad strokes, of what the GC may look like in the not too distant future of pervasive digital services accessible anywhere, any time, and what it will take to get us there.  The GCIMM 1st draft is published here for your review and comments. We look forward to receiving your feedback.

data.name: 9eaa6d0e-4b8c-5241-acf7-c6885294b8c1
data.notes: The Open Government Guidebook provides federal departments and agencies (FDA) with information on the Government of Canada’s open data and information processes. It explains the requirements of the Directive on Open Government and provides guidance to ensure consistent approaches to open data and information practices across government. The tools referenced in this document were developed by the Open Government Resource Development Working Group, an internal working group led by the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat (TBS) with participation from over 25 Government of Canada organizations.

notes_translated.en: The Open Government Guidebook provides federal departments and agencies (FDA) with information on the Government of Canada’s open data and information processes. It explains the requirements of the Directive on Open Government and provides guidance to ensure consistent approaches to open data and information practices across government. The tools referenced in this document were developed by the Open Government Resource Development Working Group, an internal working group led by the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat (TBS) with participation from over 25 Government of Canada organizations.
notes_translated.fr: Le Guide du gouvernement ouvert fournit aux ministères et aux organismes fédéraux des renseignements sur les processus d’information et de données ouvertes du gouvernement du Canada. Il explique les exigences de la Directive sur le gouvernement ouvert et fournit des orientations en vue d’assurer l’uniformité des approches à l’égard des pratiques d’information et de données ouvertes à l’échelle du gouvernement. Les outils mentionnés dans le présent document ont été élaborés par le Groupe de travail sur le développement des ressources du gouvernement ouvert, un groupe de travail interne dirigé par le Secrétariat du Conseil du Trésor du Canada avec la participation de plus de 25 organisations du gouvernement du Canada.

en: Canada-United States Regulatory Cooperation Council │coopération réglementaire
Le Conseil de coopération Canada-États-Unis en matière de réglementation

data.name: cf0c6c2b-c030-5c9b-ae13-f70144140aaa
data.notes: The document is a compilation of three presentations provided to Canadian stakeholders at a consultation event on June 14, 2017. The first presentation provides background information and a status update on regulatory cooperation activities under the Canada-U.S. Regulatory Cooperation Council. The second presentation outlines Canada’s regulatory cooperation with domestic and European Union partners. The third presentation provides an overview of key elements to include in stakeholder submissions of potential new areas for regulatory cooperation.

notes_translated.en: The document is a compilation of three presentations provided to Canadian stakeholders at a consultation event on June 14, 2017. The first presentation provides background information and a status update on regulatory cooperation activities under the Canada-U.S. Regulatory Cooperation Council. The second presentation outlines Canada’s regulatory cooperation with domestic and European Union partners. The third presentation provides an overview of key elements to include in stakeholder submissions of potential new areas for regulatory cooperation.
notes_translated.fr: Ce document est une compilation de trois présentations offertes aux intervenants canadiens à l’occasion d’une activité de consultation tenue le 14 juin 2017. La première présentation fournit des renseignements généraux et une mise à jour sur les activités de coopération en matière de réglementation dans le cadre du Conseil de coopération Canada-États-Unis en matière de réglementation. La deuxième présentation décrit la coopération en matière de réglementation entre le Canada et ses partenaires au pays et ceux de l’Union européenne. La troisième présentation donne un aperçu des éléments importants à inclure dans les présentations des intervenants sur les nouveaux secteurs d’activités où la coopération en matière de réglementation serait possible.

data.name: ee594993-3eb0-56c3-8c16-7934dd4a1796
data.notes: This is a draft work plan for the Canada Open Government Working Group for 2017-2018. The work plan covers six priority areas: adoption of Open Data Charter, identifying high value data sets, economic benefits of open data, online federated open data search, engagement and training/open data literacy, and performance measures.

notes_translated.en: This is a draft work plan for the Canada Open Government Working Group for 2017-2018. The work plan covers six priority areas: adoption of Open Data Charter, identifying high value data sets, economic benefits of open data, online federated open data search, engagement and training/open data literacy, and performance measures.
notes_translated.fr: Ébauche de plan de travail pour le Groupe de travail sur le gouvernement ouvert du Canada de 2017-2018. Le plan de travail aborde six secteurs prioritaires : adoption d’une charte sur les données ouverte; détermination d’ensembles de données d’une grande valeur; avantages économiques des données ouvertes, recherche fédérée de données ouvertes en ligne, mobilisation et formation / littéracie en matière de données ouvertes et mesures du rendement.

data.name: f440be0b-e538-5635-bc16-7b615cf11223
data.notes: Presentation by Lawrence Mudryk on Sources of uncertainty and variability in historical trends and future projections of snow cover extent and snow water equivalent at the CMOS Congress in Toronto on June 7, 2017. Please note that content is available in English only.

data.name: f637580f-e0f7-5939-bf3f-ded35ce72d2a
data.notes: The Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat worked with the SecDev Group to propose an approach to assessing the impact of open government reforms in the Government of Canada. This report is meant to be a starting point with which to facilitate a conversation within the Government of Canada and with stakeholders about what a Canadian framework for impact should include and how it can best be evaluated. Please note the document is available in English only

notes_translated.en: The Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat worked with the SecDev Group to propose an approach to assessing the impact of open government reforms in the Government of Canada. This report is meant to be a starting point with which to facilitate a conversation within the Government of Canada and with stakeholders about what a Canadian framework for impact should include and how it can best be evaluated. Please note the document is available in English only
notes_translated.fr: Le Secrétariat du Conseil du Trésor du Canada a collaboré avec le Groupe SecDev afin de proposer une approche à l’évaluation de l’impact des réformes ayant été apportées au gouvernement du Canada en matière de gouvernement ouvert. Ce rapport sert de point de départ afin de faciliter la tenue d’une conversation au sein du gouvernement du Canada, de même qu’avec les intervenants, à savoir ce que devrait contenir un tel cadre de mesure de l’impact, et comment on pourrait mieux l’évaluer. Veuillez prendre note que le contenu n’est disponible qu’en anglais.
